intro: Carex fuliginosa subsp. misandra, commonly known as the black sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family and is characterized by its dark, almost blackish-green foliage. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, bogs, and along stream banks. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are usually wind-pollinated. The subspecies misandra is distinguished by its specific morphological traits, including its leaf structure and flowering patterns.
